jibe.sdk.client.utils
Class DataConnectionUtils

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.utils.DataConnectionUtils

public class DataConnectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class, used to check the current network connection type, in a simpler manner than when using the standard Android methods.

Constructor Summary

Method Summary
static boolean is3GOrBetterAvailable(Context context)
          Checks whether a low-latency mobile data connection is currently available (3G or better).

DataConnectionUtils

public DataConnectionUtils()
Method Detail

isWifiConnectionAvailable

public static boolean isWifiConnectionAvailable(Context context)
Checks whether the phone is currently connected via Wifi.

Parameters:
context - The current context
Returns:
true, if the phone is connected via Wifi, false otherwise.

isWimaxConnectionAvailable

public static boolean isWimaxConnectionAvailable(Context context)
Checks whether the phone is currently connected via Wimax.

Parameters:
context - The current context.
Returns:
true, if the phone is connected via Wifi, false otherwise.

is3GOrBetterAvailable

public static boolean is3GOrBetterAvailable(Context context)
Checks whether a low-latency mobile data connection is currently available (3G or better).

Parameters:
context - The current context.
Returns:
true, if a EVDO Rev 0/A/B/EHRPD or UMTS/HSDPA/HSUPA/HSPA/HSPA+/LTE is available, false otherwise.

isLowLatencyDataConnectionAvailable

public static boolean isLowLatencyDataConnectionAvailable(Context context)
Checks whether a low-latency data connection is currently available. This could be a fast mobile network, Wifi or Wimax.

Parameters:
context - The current context
Returns:
true, if a low latency network is available, false otherwise.
